Both skeletal and zombie undead ones are found in Ah Za Rhoon and Rashiliyia's Tomb, whereas the zombie undead ones are also found at the entrance to Shilo Village. They are decent training for people using Ranged, Magic, or a halberd.

The Undead ones play a critical part in the Shilo Village quest. Both skeletal and zombie undead ones are found in Ah Za Rhoon and Rashiliyia's Tomb, whereas the zombie undead ones are also found at the entrance to Shilo Village. They are decent training for people using Ranged, Magic, or a halberd.

When the zombie variant is killed, they have the chance to release poison gas that would damage the player for 2-3 Hitpoints per hit. However, it is not poisonous, so Antipoison is not required. The gas only affects characters in a one-square radius around where the undead one was when it was killed, so if players kill one, they have a few seconds to run to avoid taking damage. The skeletal undead ones do not release this gas.

Asking Mosol Rei "What danger is there around here?" will cause at least 1 undead one to spawn.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
22 January 2007
(update)

The NPC was renamed from "Undead One" to "Undead one".

5 July –
19 September 2005

The skeleton version's examine was changed from "It rattles when it walks." to "A minion of Rashiliyia."

26 January –
27 June 2005

The zombie versions' examines were changed from "The animated dead, one of Rashiliyias'[sic] minions." to "The animated dead, one of Rashiliyia's minions."

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Some zombie undead ones carry a macuahuitl, a type of weapon used by the Mesoamerican Aztecs.
  • The undead ones wearing masks make the same sounds as skeletons, despite being zombies. Similarly, the skeletal undead ones holding swords and round shields make zombie sounds. This might be a glitch.
